jcr:content.jcr:title: University of Tennessee Health Science Center

contentheadline.headline: University of Tennessee Health Science Center

contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox university |name = University of Tennessee |logo = |abbreviation = UTHSC |image_name = UTHSC logo.svg |established = 1911 |closed = |type = [[Public university|Public]] |chancellor = Steve J. Schwab, M.D. |faculty = |staff = |students = 2,851 |postgrad = |doctoral = |city = [Knoxville, Tennessee] |state = [[Tennessee]] |province = |country = [[United States|USA]] |affiliations = |website = http://www.uthsc.edu/ |footnotes = }} The '''University of Tennessee Health Science Center (UTHSC)''' in [[Memphis, Tennessee|Memphis]] includes the Colleges of Allied Health Sciences, [[University of Tennessee College of Dentistry|Dentistry]], Graduate Health Sciences, [[University of Tennessee College of Medicine|Medicine]], [[Nursing]] and [[Pharmacy]]. Its pediatric residency program is affiliated with [[Le Bonheur Children's Medical Center]] and residents in pediatrics, radiology, and other fields spend time working at [[St. Jude Children's Research Hospital]] in Memphis. There are also graduate medical education programs in [[Knoxville, Tennessee|Knoxville]], [[Chattanooga, Tennessee|Chattanooga]], and [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]], family medicine centers in Knoxville, [[Jackson, Tennessee|Jackson]], and Memphis, and public and continuing education programs across the state. The Health Science Center is part of the statewide, multi-campus [[University of Tennessee system]]. As of 2010, ''[[US News and World Report]]'' ranked the College of Pharmacy 16th among American pharmacy schools. == Accreditation == The Health Science Center is accredited by the Commission on Colleges of the [[Southern Association of Colleges and Schools]] to award [[Bachelor's degree|baccalaureate]], [[master's degree|master]], and [[doctorate|doctoral]] degrees. Each of the professional colleges or programs is accredited by the appropriate agency for the profession or program. Nobel laureate [[Peter C. Doherty]] is an adjunct faculty member of this institution. == Degrees offered == The Health Science Center offers the degrees of Bachelor of Science (in certain fields), Doctor of Physical Therapy (DPT), Master of Science (MS), Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS), Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D), Doctor of Medicine (MD), Master of Science in Nursing, Doctor of Nursing Practice, and Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm.D). Additional combined degree programs, such as DNP/Ph.D, MD/Ph.D, and Pharm.D/Ph.D are also offered. For [[medical school]] graduates, the office of Graduate Medical Education (GME) oversees 55 different [[Residency (medicine)|residency programs]] and fellowships on the UTHSC campus. The UT GME Program is statewide with approximately 900 residents training in participating hospitals located in Chattanooga, Jackson, Knoxville, Memphis, and Nashville. ==See also== *[[Medical District, Memphis]] *[[Le Bonheur Children's Medical Center]] *[[St. Jude Children's Research Hospital]] *[[University of Tennessee College of Medicine]] ==External links== *[http://www.uthsc.edu/ UTHSC Official Website] *[http://www.uthsc.edu/Medicine/ UTHSC College of Medicine Homepage] *[http://www.uthsc.edu/pharmacy/ UTHSC College of Pharmacy Homepage] *[http://www.uthsc.edu/GME/ Graduate School of Medicine] {{UTsystem}} {{Tennessee public universities}} {{Colleges and universities in the Memphis Metro Area}} {{coord missing|Tennessee}} {{DEFAULTSORT:University Of Tennessee Health Science Center}} [[Category:University of Tennessee|Health Science Center]] [[Category:Universities and colleges in Memphis, Tennessee|Tennessee, University of]] [[Category:Universities and colleges in Tennessee]] [[Category:Schools of medicine in Tennessee]] [[Category:Hospitals in Tennessee]] [[Category:Oak Ridge Associated Universities]]
